meaning_mnemonic: This radical swings like a monkey, howls like a wolf, and pounces like a leopard. You can almost hear the jungle chorus… This is the radical for <radical>animal</radical>!
What do you call a prison for drops of water? A <radical>pool</radical>! The water may not like being in there, but the rest of us sure appreciate it on a hot summer day.
This radical is the same as the kanji. It means <radical>public</radical>.

This is the radical for well — the kind you use to draw up water. Picture an old-timey stone well with wooden posts holding up a crank for reeling up your bucket! Pretty well built, huh? Well, well… Still can't see it? Try another view: picture a well seen from above. This one's got a square-shaped opening, 'cause that's what Japanese wells used to look like in the old days. Hope this one works well for you!
This radical is the same as the kanji. It means <radical>part</radical>.
This radical is the same as the kanji. It means  <radical>talent</radical>.

It's the drunkard from before, but this time she's leaning on some kind of horizontal surface. Knowing her, it's probably the counter of a <radical>bar</radical>. Hopefully she's not causing too much trouble for the bar staff with her drunken antics.
